title: Kylie Jenner and Travis Scott get very flirty as she gushes Stormi is a daddy's girl
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Kylie Jenner and Travis Scott flirted up a storm on Instagram.

The make-up mogul and the rapper proved to be the world's friendliest exes as they shared a cheeky social media exchange on Thursday.

It started heating up after the mother-of-one uploaded a video of their daughter Stormi dancing to her morning lullaby Rise & Shine.

"Daddy’s girl." She captioned the video.

Travis commented within half an hour with a heart emoji. He wrote: "Wild."

In the clip, Kylie gushed her little girl was a "daddy's girl" when she showered her with affection.

(Image: DPA/PA Images)

(Image: Instagram)

Just moments before, the reality star was left with a little disappointment when Stormi begged to hear her dad sing instead.

"Daddy sing," Stormi begged.

She replied: "No baby that's mummy. That's mummy sing... Oh you want daddy singing? I'm not good enough."

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

This cute exchange shut down recent claims Kylie allegedly put Travis through hell and he was ready to fight back.

The couple were reunited for the first time in two months following their split.

They were spotted together at the pumpkin patch where they played with their daughter.

Their split was marred with rumours the rapper cheated on the Kardashian with YungsweetRo.

However, the exes have maintained they have remained amicable for the sake of their daughter.

Kylie uploaded the clip after Ariana Grande expressed an interest in her Rise & Song lullaby.

The Thank U, Next hitmaker suggested teaming up with the Keeping Up With The Kardashians star for her next hit.

Ariana took to Instagram to post a video of herself singing the lullaby and said "@kyliejenner can i sample".
description:
Kylie uploaded the clip after Ariana Grande
expressed an interest in her Rise & Song lullaby
